{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3279840,"name":null,"username":"Yuri","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/yuri/{size}/218839_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-10T18:10:55.276Z","cooked":"

i am in the process of buiyng led strips for my robot, but i am worring about how to energize it, because the led strip is 5v and consumes 14,4W per meter, with is equivalent to 2,2 A per meter. and we are planning to use about 3 meter of led’s, and that is about 6,6 amps. at first i tought about of using de VRM from CTRE, but the max current for a port is 2 A. i dont know how to proceed

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-01-10T18:10:55.276Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":21,"reads":151,"readers_count":150,"score":135.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":449237,"topic_slug":"how-to-energize-led-strips-properly","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62012,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I like making sparks with batteries"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-energize-led-strips-properly/449237/1","custom_user_title":"I like making sparks with batteries","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3280073,"name":"Kevin S","username":"Kevin_S","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/cc9497/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-10T20:38:28.397Z","cooked":"

I haven’t read through the rules this year yet, but generally custom circuits are allowed for things like LEDs and sensors, so you probably dont have to use the official electronics to step down your voltage. Make sure that your custom electronics are protected by a breaker on the PDH so that if something goes wrong, it trips the appropriately rated breaker.

You can search for a voltage converter that goes from 12 volts to 5 volts at whatever amp rating you need, you can probably use something like this: Amazon.com

comicsans:

using the [Mini Power Module - REV Robotics ](mini power module) you can get 5v

The MPM is a power distribution solution for lower current (custom) circuits - it does NOT give you any regulated voltage output. Do not connect a 5V device directly to an MPM.

What you need is a voltage regulator. There are lots of choices. The VRM is one, but expensive for what it is, and does not supply enough current for many applications (such as yours). The post I linked gives some examples of other options.

Also keep in mind the draw of the LEDs varies greatly based on the brightness/color. You might not need as much as you think….

Hollisms:

LEDs varies greatly based on the brightness/color

Also the amount of LEDs per meter. You can get away with further spacing and still be visible. You can also diffuse it behind scratched up acrylic to hide any gaps. Ofc then you’ll need to make it brighter again
